snippet: Nacho Carbonell on “Unknown Shell,” his contribution to “KAMA, Sex and Design” at the Triennale Design Museum in Milan.
abstract: Artist Nacho Carbonell discusses his installation piece Unknown Shell, 14-foot-sculpture made of baking paper and intended to symbolize woman, as well as how he furnishes his own living space.
lead_paragraph: Nacho Carbonell on “Unknown Shell,” his contribution to “KAMA, Sex and Design” at the Triennale Design Museum in Milan.

headline.seo: Nacho Carbonell on His Contribution to “KAMA, Sex and Design”
headline.main: An Artist’s Obscure Object of Desire
headline.print_headline: An Artist’s Obscure Object of Desire
